text: Bottle pour at Andrews. Thank you for this. Crisp clear golden pour. Thick body, sweet aroma some cinnamon and oak, flavor is full honey sweet apple bomb.

Bottle pour in Seattle, thanks Andrew. Even though I actually procured this bottle. Surprisingly dark amber gold, clear and thick. Intense honey and a pinch of alcohol. Intensely flavorful nectar. An earthy, actual granola flavor with some caramel sugar. This one in particular is reminiscent of mead. A very nice treat, but not my favorite example of style.

A dark golden cider with aroma of beautiful apple jam, light maple, alcohol warmth, very nice and smooth. In mouth, a beautiful complex mix of cooked apple jam, light maple, light acidity, alcohol warmth, nice and enticing. Bottle at Lautre oeil.

At home. Bottle shared by Maakun, thanks for a first taste of ice cider! Clear golden, no head. Sweet apple syrup, honey, nutmeg, moss, apple skin, light brandy boozy. Big sweet. Full body, sticky thick and oily smooth. Very low carbonation. Big long delicate sweet finish. Powerful sweet and deep aroma, very nice.
bottle 2012 oro aranciato passito leggere etilico frutata tendenza dolce piuttosto complesso

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2016 Bouteille 375ml, 2012. Couleur or translucide, infimes particules en suspension, film sur les parois du verre. Arôme de pomme fraiche, légère acidité, soupçon d?alcool, sucre d?érable, pomme cuite. Goût de pomme fraiche, pelure de pomme, sucré, pomme caramélisée, légère acidité en fin de bouche. Corps dense, sirupeux, collant.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Thank You mjs! Sweet, pure apple extract. Thick and full bodied. I have never had a cider like that. Feels like a apple liqueur.

375 ml bottle poured. 2012 vintage. Huge thanks to mcberko for the bottle. This totally exceeded every expectation I had for ice ciders. Golden pour. Smooth apple, cinnamon and honey heavy aroma. Thick body, syrupy, complex apple and honey flavor. Smooth apple sauce like finish, with an endless apple spice linger. Glad this coincidentally landed on a milestone rate. This stuff is a magic potion. Loved it.
[2012] 50ml bottle. Clear golden amber. Flavors are cooked/caramelized apples, juicy apple flesh/peel, cinnamon and alcohol with citrusy notes. Mild tartness. Medium body, slick texture.

375ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) - thanks mjs!
Apple and booze aroma. Apple everywhere, some core bitterness there too. Very boozy at every step. Harsh and sharp, yet sugary on the lips too. Has no drinkability at all, and even lacks sipability.
375ml bottle (mjs). Clear dark golden color. Sweet, caramel, apples, bit watery aroma. I got three words to describe it- sweet apple jam. Way too sweet. Damn its sweet.
Bottle. Pours golden without head. Aroma is sweet, apple peal, some alcohol. Flavor is sweet, apple, sourness. Overall: very good.

(Bottle, 0.375 l, from Alko, 20150926) The cider poured deep golden and clear. No head. Aroma had apples, sweetness and apple peels. Palate was sticky and full bodied. Flavours were sweetness, apples, apple peels and mild tartness. Aftertaste was sweet and mildly tart. A well done sweet cider.

Clear golden, no head. Nose is tons of apple and apple peel, some sweetness, funky notes. Flavor is thick with apples, more apple peel and sour apple notes, syrupy sweetness. Finishes with sour apple peel and syrup. Lingering apple peel.
Bottle at THT tasting. Clear yellow pour. Aroma full of apples, some sherry, some alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, clean and crispy. Nice.

Sampled from bottle @ Hey Julien is back and Deans floor is moist tasting. Clear apple juice golden color, no head. Smell and taste are -I know, not much help but this is what it is- strong but balanced concentrated apple juice. Low carbonation, good body.

Bottle at THT. Lovely golden color with no head. Massive sweet apple, touch of sour juice, fresh Granny Smith apple peels, sugary, soft tart apple juice, very light brandy. Oh wow this is fucking nuts. Very sweet and light tartness. Over medium bodied, no carbonation and thick feel. Love it.

Sample at the THT September
No head or carbonation. Clear golden pour. Wow. Another awesome Canadian ice cider.

Bottle shared thanks to JulienHuxley. Pours clear golden orange with no head. Aroma of sweet red apples. Amplified. In the most wonderful way. Flavour is light heavy sweet. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at 2015 Sweet & Sour.Bought it from a store in Vancouver, BC, Canada.Clear golden oily color, some legs. Sweet, fresh apple, some alcohol scent. Sweet, oily, apple, fresh, smooth taste. Smooth, rich, oily mouthfeel, no bitterness. Light apple core finish.
Bottle 2nd midlands tasting. Golden colour. Aroma is sweet sugary apples. Taste is very sweet like apple sours sour sweet finish some alcohol. Nice syrupy body! loved this very good.
Bottle. Clear pale amber with no head. Sweet apple, yeasty aroma. Sweet apple and some other fruits flavour. I loved this one :-)

Bottle courtesy of Gnoff. Pours very tiny cloudy deep golden leaving some beautiful legs on the glass. Smell is intense with ripe aromatic apples, star fruit, blue cheese, vanilla, minerals, alcohol and lemon peal. Taste is sweet, sour and heavy fruity. Mouthfeel is viscous, oily, round, tart and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and sour with apples, star fruit, pineapple, minerals, alcohol and lemon peal. Amazing tropical fruit character. Intense and just great.

Bottle at Timos Summer Tasting 2005-08-15. Clear pale with no head. Sweet Apple aroma, funky, yeast notes, caramel, grapes and raisins. Sweet apple flavor, sugary, grapes, peach, raisins, warming alcohol. Sweet but really nice.
Bottle. Pours clear pale golden amber. Aroma is sweet sourish buttery fruity apples. Flavor is quite sour sweet yet still leaving mouth somewhat dry. Longlived sour apples sweet fruity finish.

Bottle picked up at M & S, Oxford and consumed at Cropredy, Fairports Annual Reunion Festival 2015, Thurs 13th shared with Craig, Pluckett, Alec, Nellie, Bob (it was very popular)   Rich golden colour, you can see that this is has a thick consistency with oily legs. Sweet concentrated appley aromas, some oak, this is apple pie territory with thoughts of nutmeg and cinnamon also thrown in there to confuse you. The flavour is along similar lines, but like Pluckett quite correctly notes that intense sweet apple just stays with you. This is seriously good, like a top notch dessert wine, love it. A8 A4 T9 P4 Ov17 4.2

50 ml bottle from SAQ, 2010 harvest. Crystal clear deep amber-copper pour. Aroma of boozy apples, quite volatile, earthy notes, toasted oak, candied apples, raisins, sherry. Taste is sweet, very rich, liquory apple flavor, spicy, apple pie notes, light sherry notes. Palate is boozy, warming alcohol feel, full bodied and mouth coating. Very nice.

2nd annual Midlands tasting group. Bottle shared thanks to Garrold, cheers Gary for my first Ice Cider. Golden still liquor. Aroma of masala desert wine and puréed apples. Taste is masala desert wine,very sweet and concentrated Apple sauce. Sticky palate. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle during 2nd Annual Midlands tasting group; clear golden yellow pour with zero head, sweet syrup aroma, taste has sweet dessert wine, some apple.

375ml bottle. 2011 vintage. Pours a clear, brilliant caramel with some nice legs. Aroma is a big, sweet, condensed apple sauce. Taste is sweet. Lots of Apple, pear, hints of peach, honey, apricot, and a great tart/acidity at the end. Full body with no carbonation. Sweet, syrupy texture. Overall awesome! Big Apple, pear, peach, and honey. But I also love ice wine.
Somewhat sweet apple smell. Taste is heavy on the apple sweetness with a bit of caramel taste in there as well. Really delicious.

Poured from a 50ml bottle. Pours as a viscous golden syrup. The aroma is juicy apples, apple rind, slight spicy character. The flavor is sweet apples, juicy, slight tartness that helps balance the sweetness. Very tasty. Warming alcohol.

pours unclear bright gold with elegant legs sticking. thick caramelized apples and its brown sugar and butter coulis, bit of skin for light astringent, woodsy and lightly tart notes - just the right dose of acidity, few spices. flat carbonation, medium body - almost syrupy, sweet, very gently tart fruity finish. very well crafted ice cider but their reserve is a few notches above.

37,5cl bottle from Waitrose. It pours a rich golden color with no head to speak of. Aroma is sweet sticky and intense, with notes of boiled apples, apple syrup, caramel and raisin wine. Taste is very sweet, sticky, with notes of caramel, toffee, boiled apples and raisin wine again. Light musty tones. Quite complex. Thick flat body. Overall, very interesting and really tasty, ideal with dessert.

Bottle. M&S, Meadowhall, Sheffield. Clear, dark gold. Big aroma of freshly stewed, still warm, lightly caramelised dessert apples. On top of that, theres a little solvent booziness. Taste is very sweet. Theres some apple core / apple pip dryness. Palate is a little boozy, with an astringency keeping things in check. Finish is juicy, dessert apple sweet. Light dry, boozy close. Dryer and fresher than I thought it might be. Very nice.
UPDATED: JUL 13, 2014 Bottle shared by my Dad, crisp and rich apple. Banging ass drink. Had it before but a nice 5 year old tick now. Well take it.

Bright golden pour. The aroma is rich and sweet with notes if baked apple. A sharp acidity balances rich sweetness and a warming finish. Rich and fruity but not the most complex example Ive come across.

Its Pinnacles 2005 Reserve Ice Cider. 12% Bottle that was a gift from my folks, thanks! Drunk to celebrate St-Jean with some apple pie & vanilla ice cream. Served in a champagne flute. It pours a glowing amber color and has a potent sweet apple, almost apple blossom aroma with some booziness and even notes of candy caramel. Soft silky smooth mouthfeel and full body. Tart apple flavor, peppery, sweet, sugary, juicy apple taste and a slow burning warmth going down your throat. Paired with the vanilla ice cream that vanilla and creamy character is accented with the ice cider comes off softer and more delicately. Paired with the pie you get more spice out of the cider, lots of heat and caramel very piquante. I had no idea a cider could be so complex.

Poured at co-ops grape escape. Pours a clear bright golden orangish with tiny effervescent bubbles. Aroma of apples, tart and sweet combined with a cobbler like finish. Taste is tart apples up front turning sweet apples, honey, pears and brown sugar. Mouthfeel is slick and oily with with a medium low carbonation but a great complexion of flavors.

2006 bottle that was a gift from "hannont". Colour...clear, deep gold. Nose...brimming with sharply tart apple skins and apple cobbler. Palate...a quick sharp hit of super tart apples, with apple leaf, honey and steeped apple flesh. The back of the palate is nicely tangy with hints of dry earth and tea.

Sa couleur dorée et limpide inspire confiance. Il y a de minuscules bulles en grande quantité dans mon verre. Cest de la compote de pomme qui me vient à lesprit lorsque je me lapproche du nez. Ça sent la pomme mûre et la pomme cuisinée. Ça picote lors de passage en bouche. Une forte acidité accompagne le côté sucré. Cest suret et ça tâtonne le devant du palais. Cuvée 2010 (1030-060314)

Bottle (375 ml). 2010 harvest. Clear bright golden/orange-ish. Aroma is of sweet apples with brown sugar notes, sweetness and pear. Taste is moderately(for an Ice Cider) / heavily sweet with sweet apples, brown sugar, pears and hints of red fruits. Medium body. Oily. Not as thick as some other Ice Ciders. Quite complex and not too sweet for the style. Very good!

Thank you Tommy for sharing this one! My first Ice Cidre. 2010 Harvest

A - Gorgeous bronze / gold appearance. this cider really shines.

S - The most concentrated ripe apple puree and skins Ive ever smelled. Notes of cherry, blackberry and pear as well. 

T - The taste is amazing. Brandy or maybe rum liquor. Concentrated intense Apple. Loads of sweet dessert tastes, roasted apples, lots of sweet sugar and a big of peaches in syrup as well.

M - Very slick, very thin intense residual sugar.

O - This is absolutely incredible. I should join RateCider.

Pours a nice and still golden, it also sticks to the side of the glass to give a nice "dentelle" effect. Aroma is of cooked/cooking apples, pretty straight-forward. Taste is of reduced apple juice and brown sugar/simple syrup impressions. A nice acidity clears the palate and leave you wanting for more (never cloying). Mouthfeel is sticky, the drink itself not too heavy. Really nice!
2010. Opened August 2013. Clear golden body. Bright sweet-apples, light carmelized sugar and honey. Straightforward profile that is intense, assertive, and enjoyable. Moderate sweetness.

Only a small taste unfortunately from a 5 cl. bottle. Very cool packaging. Clear golden. Taste is quite sweet, apples, reminiscent of a white desert wine, white grapes and honey, more sweet apples. Alcohol is kept in place. Less heavy body than expected. Very nice but expected more complexity to be honest.

oz pour served in a champagne flute. Aroma is fleshy apple, as if on a cutting board in front of you. Taste is warm alcohol, sweet apple, hint of brown sugar. Mouthfeel is slight carbonation, but smooth, silky, and decadent.

Bottle picked up in Montreal. Pours a less viscous gold, still. Nose is more cider forward with some earthy notes and pure apple. Tart in the nose, less complexity than others. Faint sherry like notes but more apple. On tasting, medium bodied with a strong apple presence. Some sherry that almost pushes into papery. Bitter alcohol and warming. Crisp and refreshing but really lacking the complexity of the greats. Okay.

Bottle, shared with my wife and Grippitis. Lovely soft golden colour, nice legs, completely still. Aroma is equally apples and honey sweetness, maybe a light toffee element too.  Sweet sticky palate, crushed apples, honey, light toffee or burnt sugar (very light, but certainly a different sweet note than the honey), lightly floral elements too. There is an acidity here, not quite a tartness, that lifts things beautifully. Gosh, now Im getting some apricots toward the end? This stuff is so delicious, so complex. The mouthfeel and sweetness profile reminds me of sauternes. Outstanding!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 2009 Vintage. 375mL bottle, pours a flat clear golden / copper. Very aromatic with intense notes of concentrated apple, honey and a little treacle. Flavour is very intense and rich with incredible depth - sweet concentrated apples, some fresh pure honey nectar, a touch of vanilla and a treacly character. Theres a sort of liqueur quality, but the alcohol isnt really that prominent. So much depth and flavour to this one. The sweetness is intense but not cloying in any way. Remarkable stuff.

Harvest 2010
Clear golden colour. Aroma of apple, white wine, light young cheese. Sweet apple flavour, white wine, sweet muscat, light sour touch. Finish apple, muscat, light sour, lingering sweet.
Really nice brew. Reminds of a nice dessert wine.
(from 5cL bottle @ home, obtained at the Brussels Xmas market)

375 ml bottle (12,5%) @ wPBF13.
Pours clear golden color with no head. Aroma of apples, some grass and herbal notes. Flavor of sugar, sweet apple and pear. Lice concentrate apple juice.
5334

375 ml bottle @ WPBF 2013.
Pours a golden colour without a head. Aroma is very rich with strong green apples, some vanilla and caramel. Flavour of intense tart-ish green apples, flowers, sugar, white grapes and wood. Full bodied, very sticky mouthfeel and low carbonation. Alcohol warms nicely. So much apples that this is rather close to an apple juice concentrate. My first ice cider.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, no head. Aroma is very sweet apples, some green apples and thats about it. Flavour is sweet green apples, mild nectar and very beautifully balanced. Hides the abv very well.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2013 
37,5 cl bottle (12,5%) @ wPBF as Pinnacle Ice Apple Wine
Aroma has moldy cellar notes and some apples. Flavour is rather sweet and very intensive with lots and lots of apples  feels like an apple juice concentrate. Also some tartness and nicely warming alcohol. Leathery finish. My first ice cider. Nice.

The cidery told me that this is sold in Europe with that name due to the country regulations. ABV varies between 11% and 12.5%

2006. My first glass will be drank warmer than the next one will be. Tonight is the night that the Flames removed Iginla from the line up assumingly as a precaution for an impending trade - Ill guess to the Bruins. Warm sweet green apple mush, scents of very slight mulling, pile of red apple skins, apple sauce, pretty good. Tasty stuff that Im finding myself drinking quite fast. There is a sweet tart overall lingering and opening. Liquid apple sauce, building spice / bold flavour, thickness, ok sourness, bit of earth. Tannic, mildly appealing biting finish. I dig. Ice cider has always been good to me.

Big thanks to sebletitje for sharing this with me. The bottle pours a nice deep yet water clear to some extent gold and leaves behind some decent legginess. The aroma offers up sweet red apples, a sugar smell and apple juice soaked mildly earthy apple skins. The taste delivers the expected rich yummy flavors where I get deep smooth sweet green apple sweetness and green apple tartness with a dash of earthiness. It digs into more rich apple sweetness for a moment before increasing green apple like tartness moves into a dry sensation at the finish. Yum! This entertains a lovely play between rich sweetness and tannin apple skin like tartness.

5cl bottle in a nice tin box bought at the Brussels xmas market.
Doré claire rendant ce côté jus de pomme clarifié, le tout laisse un filament doré sur les rebords du verre.
Arôme est évidement de pomme avec un bouquet sucré rappelant le sucre concentré mais aussi de ce dessert de pomme au four. Garde aussi ce côté peau de pomme verte qui ressort super bien au-delà des effluves de sucré.
Palais est ici, également savoureux. Pomme pressée avec un sucré concentré naturel tirant vers le caramélisé. e note toujours ce côté peau de pomme qui rend qcq notes de tanin qui sont suivis de suite par un onctueux sucré. Ce dernier ne domine en rien le cidre mais accompagne un profil gardant fidèlement la complexité des pommes. Le tout offre un fini râpeux (voire finement épicé) sur la langue mettant ici encore la présence des tanins à lhonneur.
Modial du Biere.  This was an absolutly delicious ice cider that I would love to try again sometime.
Bottle at Chris. Clear deep gold no head. Very aopley aroma. Very nice some sweetness. wow that has been lovely. Gorgeous. Would drink all day everyday.

50 ml bottle bought in brussels ( christmas market )
pours like applejuice, maybe a bit thicker.
scent in the bottle is pure apple. after pouring in my BBF 2012 tasting glass, the smell of alcohol is more prominant. 
taste is very nice. thick aple juice, some alcohol ( warmth ) aftertaste is apples again.as this is my first ice cider ( second cider but the first was half beer half cider) i wont be able to say wether this is better than others or not. i do am able to say i like this, but not as much as a good imperial stout.
Bottle @ Chriso. Pours a clear golden color with no head. has a fruity tart apple aroma. Very sweet fruity tart green apple flavor. Has a sweetish fruity tart apple finish.

Bottle at Chriso Tasting, London. Thanks to Chris for providing this wonderful beverage. Pours clear, bright gold with no head. Fairly juicy apple aroma, some stewed apples and apple sauce. Big sweet flavor with rich apples, mellow alcohol. Full bodied and lightly chewy. Warm finish with some sticky sugars, faint sting, rich apple sauce. Not cloying. Very delicious. Great stuff.

Cost was about the only thing keeping me from trying this style, the wife has been digging mead lately so I figured this might be up her alley, it was. 

The cider pours a deep golden with a nice sheeting on the glass. 

The aroma is extraordinarily pungent, very apple-y & florally sweet. 

The flavor is very tart, almost sour... but not quite. Its a much richer tartness than say just that of a green apple, although there is a good bit of apple flavor to the cider. The alcohol is present but not overbearing, it imparts a nice spiciness to the drink. Some orange and bright citrus fruit flavors are abound. 

It is indeed sometimes good to stray outside of your normal price range for the sake of a nice drink.

Bottle from Liquor Depot, Banff. It pours rich golden yellow. The nose is sweet apple, perfumed, apple skin, nectarine, peach, ambergris and sweet marzipan. The taste is rich, sweet apple, tangyiness, white grape, nectarine, honey, some saltiness and underlying alcohol warmth, with a tangy, sweet finish. Medium-full body and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Some fruit sourness cuts through the sweetness and provides balance. A very nice beverage indeed.

Bottle. Aroma is of apples and white wine with some alcohol in the background, Color is clear light amber. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is a little thick and syrupy, and theres the faintest hint of carbonation. First time trying and Ice Cider, and this ones pretty good.

Gotta love this stuff.... amazing!
Sweetness perfectly balanced with the acidity...

50mL sample bottle from LCBO.  Pours clear amber.  Aroma of caramel, baked/rotting apples, and raisins.  Taste is boozy, very sweet, with some funky apples.  Sticky mouthfeel.  Enjoyable, but Ive had better ice ciders.

Bottle 375ml. clear glass.[ Courtesy of 3fourths ]. Clear medium yellow colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy apple, sour apple, intense apple and very concentrated apple. Flavour is heavy sweet and light light acidic with a long duration, concentrated apple, tart apple. Just lovely ;O). Body is medium to full, texture is watery - syrupy, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120511]

Bottle brought back as contraband by my Quebecoise friend. I love the way desert wines roll around in the glass, and this was a pretty little thing.
Nose: scuffed, soft, wrinkly apples laying in rotting fallen leaves, maybe some kind of Russet. Brown bubbly melted cheese, hints of butter--really, like apple pie with burnt cheese on top (lol, thanks for the shoutout GT). 
Mouth--oily like when cheddar melts and sweats. Lighter than expected, fairly simple. Pretty, feminine acidity, but the cheesiness gets a little clunky, keeping it more rustic, less elegant. Quite a treat drinking this on the beach by Hamlets castle!

Sample @ CBC, Courtesy of 3fourths. Clear deep golden with no head. Aroma is apples, intense and fruit. Flavour is apples, fruit, sweet, little citrus, intense, little vanilla, little citric and a little tart.

CBC. Courtesy of 3fourths at the friday night dinner. Travelling with an Ice Cider in your bag just cannot go wrong. Clear yellow without head. Aroma is sweet apples, vanilla, marcipan and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet. Very sweet finish. Oily. 110512

Bottle @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, courtesy of 3Fourths, Thanks! Pours clear golden with lacings. Aroma of ripe apples, wood, honey, alcohol. Taste is very rich ripe green and rep apples, sweets, honey, wood and green  leave notes, alcohol. Full oily body, low or no carbonation, quite some alcohol, but never burning. nice. 110512
Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012.  Sample. Pours clear golden with bubbles on top. Sweet red apples. Ripe. Tart and dry. Delicious.

Bottle shared by 3fourths and Diane. Flat golden pour with heavy legs. Apple pie with melted cheese on top (stolen from master sommelier Diane.) Taste is super rich, salty, sugary, cheesy, with rich apple pie. Acid cut through a rich sugary dessert profile. Nice palate. The nose is a little inferior to other top rated ice ciders. I would like to see some more complex stone fruit brightness. But, you cant really go wrong with ice ciders.

Clear, flat deep golden.  Aromas of sweet apple (thats been left sitting on the counter for too long).  Kind of a baked apple now that I think of it.  Plus quite potent alcohol that really rises through the nose like brandy.  Syrupy.  Tasty, not for drinking in bulk.

Bottle (2007) This cider rocks! Clear golden cider that coats the side of the glass, but provides minimal legwork. Fresh and fallen apples are the olfactory highlights. Full-bodied and viscous with a rumor of carbonation. The flavor is both sweet and tart. Excellent apple sweetness and acidity accompanied by a hint of tannic bitterness. Finishes pleasantly tart, syrupy-sweet and modestly boozy. Kudos to darkguardian for uncorking this beauty!

375ml bottle from the LCBO [2009 vintage], pours an orangish yellow with no head minor curtaining on the wine glass. Aroma of apple, sweetness and a faint hint of rotten fruit. Flavours of apple and a hint of rotten fruit. The initial flavour is a tad rotten tasting but the finish is phenomenal. texture is syroupy, with no carbonation. First ice cider. I enjoyed it but did not blow me out of the water. 
For clarification: I enjoyed the rotten fruit taste. It had an almost barnyard like character to it. Overall this cider is really good--just not great.

200ml bottle shared by Doug on Christmas 2011, thanks man 
Appearance:Apples, sugar and some heat 
Aroma: Clear yellow with no head or lacing but nice sticky legs 
Taste: Apples with some tartness and a sweet dry finish 
Great, I wish we could get these locally.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2012 My first ice cider. It will be tough to beat. Intensely apple in every way. Beautifully balanced sweetness - and I like the way the granny smith tartness cuts through the sweet apple flavor. Nice golden color - great finish...theres nothing i dont like about this cider!

200 ml bottle in those tall and thick glass bottles, bought in Montreal. Pours a nice thick golden color with sticky legs running down the glass. The aroma is bursting out apples, some warmth and sugar. The flavor is akin to a concentrated honey crisp apple with tartness and super sweet apples. Decadent. The palate makes it insanely drinkable. Lovely.

Pours a viscous translucent golden colour. Strong aromas of well-fermented apples, apple cores, wet-dirt, mushroom and wood. The sweetness is medium heavy to heavy, but is not too overpowering. Most of the aforementioned notes from aroma carry through into the taste, along with a caramel note. The palate is syrupy and smooth. Overall a nice ice-cider, tad bit pricey though.
UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Bottle. My first ice cider. Intensely apple, sweet, definitely a dessert beverage. Quite nice.
Bottle, pours a nice colour, smell is very appley and taste so as well, it has a nice sweetness but not too sweet, this one is up there with the best of ice ciders, very nice oiffering
2007 bottle. Pours a clear gold. My first ice cider, so hard to be objective - delicious syrupy sweet apples & honey with a touch of acid in the finish. I need to find more of this stuff!

2007 bottle at daks 9/5/10.

thick, oily clear yellow pour.

great aroma of cooked and bruised apples, wood and flowers. 

intense creamy apple flavor with incredible balance of tart and sweet.

thick, sweet, delicious nectar. wish i had me some roquefort...9/4/9/4/18

Sampled from the bottle. Poured a clear pale yellow with no head whatsoever. Aroma was sweet with apples but has enough acidity to balance nicely. Flavor started sweet with apples but was balanced by a nice acidity and tartness. A hint of honey as well. Quite nice.

375 ml bottle, 2006.  Clear golden straw with a pink tint.  Nose is cotton candy, apple juice, lemon spritzer and candied rose petals.  Silky, syrupy and sticky with a sour tang and a mild sparkle.  Taste is applesauce, lemon zest, cinnamon stick and oak.  Sweetness held beautifully in check with green apple tartness.  Almost cloying but could also be called a sour.

2oz blind tasting of 16 different Ice Ciders.
Aroma : Caramelized apples, light acidic notes. Light alcohol.

Taste : Quite a lot of alcohol with caramelized apples. Finish quite alcoholic. Light spices. Rather dry. 

Overall : A bit disapointing. Too much alcohol especially on the finish. Some interesting notes here and there but nothing enough to make up for the alcohol.

Blind tasting scoring sheet : Aroma : 4/10 Balance : 4/10 Complexity : 6/10. General : 9/20. Ranking : 15/16.

Pour golden yellow.Aroma smells like great homemade apple pie cinnamon apples and delicious. Taste super sweet, cinnamon, apples, like a fresh market cider not tart or sour. MF a little thick abv well hidden. Overall very good but super sweet do not over pour or you will not finish.

From a bottle at mesandsims monster tasting. Never had an ice cider before and it was quite an experience. Its nothing like anything Ive had before. Its almost like a condiment. I think every house needs one of these at the dinner table. Clear yellow gold with no head. Aroma of apples, flavour too with a hint of vanilla and spice. Weird and cakey. A real assault of the senses. Odd and nice.

Pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Pours a clear amber gold.  Warm apples and ice cream on the nose.  Soft vanilla notes paired up with sweet apple compote.  Warming tanginess and long lingering acids on the finish.

(Bouteille de 50 ml)  Le liquide a une belle couleur dorée.  Le nez est invitant avec des arômes doux de pommes qui rencontrent des effluves de fleurs de miel et des épices.  Le goût est tout aussi intéressant avec des saveurs fruitées fortes et légèrement boisées (pommes mûres et jeunes poires).  La charge sucrée du liquide est bien atténuée par la présence de notes justement acidulées.  En bouche, le liquide simpose fortement avec sa texture soyeuse et sirupeuse.  En finale, les notes surettes simposent difficilement et préfèrent la tendresse du sucre des fruits.

375 mL bottle.  Clear copper-yellow in colour.  The nose is apple of course, and leans to the sweet side.  There is a hint of spice, apple peel and light citrus as well.  The flavour has a good amount of sweet apple as well, but it is not cloying, and it is cut with vanilla, spice and apple peel.  Nice body.  Great cider.
Thick clear golden pour. Aroma of sweet-tart apples, honey, yeast and wildflowers. Similar flavor of sweet apples, honey, tartness, delicious. Really awesome.

Extra in a trade with a BA bud. :) Shared with family in the backyard during a late summer evening.

Baby Duvel tulip. Clear amber yellow hue with a twinge of maple. Darker then the press photo shows. 2006 edition.

Scents of honey, new grass, & bold macerated apples. There is also a strong tannic sharpness in the surrounding air. Almost like a whiskey sour.

Taste is mostly comprised of sweet/hearty apples, along with lots of drying/leathery oak, tea, & just enough tartness. Tastes more like a bolder iced wine aged incredibly long in the barrel, leaving residuals of cooled brandy, must, & stiff tannins. The sugars come off deep but clean, & have less maple & caramelization then in other ice ciders. Actually, the tartness is very moderate when compared to the scent, & cuts it almost like a small lemon wedge in a large glass of iced tea.

Body isnt syrupy, but close. It is coating, velvety, & moderately lingering. The alcohol is apparent, but is only responsible for a bit of sensual cooling as it evaporates from my lips.

Not as big with the sweet/tart contrasts as others, but has more going on then most in my opinion. 

A great treat.
user_location: FT: Stale Polotmavý in Queens, New York, USA

text: UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 375ml bottle of "Winter Gold Ice Apple Wine," an apparent re-branding according to the hosts of the ice cider tasting at CiderDays 2010. Wild, funky woodsy apple aroma. Complex and herbal. Pours a clear mid-gold. Savory, buttery, grilled cheese sandwich, and fresh cut cheddar flavors. The acids and sugars are nicely balanced and this comes across as purely refined. I love the deeper savory edges to this. Fun.

(bottle thanks to bu11zeye) Dark orange. Smells of some cinnamon, dried apples, musk, caramel. Wow this is hotter than expected (I guess it is 12% so maybe I should have expected pretty hot.) Very sweet, caramel, clove. Still mouthfeel. Interesting and complex.
Rich golden pour. Sweet apples, honey, and wildflowers. Sweet apples, honey, tartness, delicious. Really awesome.

(375ml bottle thanks to Mora2000) rich yellow with great alcohol legs. Nose of fermented apples, alcohol, white wine, and barrel. Taste of very sweet apples, syrup, sugar, smooth body with a very sweet, diabetes finish. Excellent!

Bottle shared by bu11zeye (I think!!).  Light golden pour.  Apple and spice nose.  Green apple / green pear taste.  Reminds me of a Riesling wine in color and taste.  A bit on the sweet side, but maybe nice after dinner.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2010 Well played, Mora2000...well played..
Honey is very strong.  apple (duh), reminds me of cognac because of the lingering taste.
Pours a nice orange color. The aroma is strong apples with quite a bit of sugar. The flavor is apples, sugar and vanilla. A great dessert cider and one that I could drink again and again.

clear golden, no head.
boozy and apple aroma
flavor is sweet and citrussy apple, a little bitterness is disturbing, otherwise a great ice cider.

Rating no. 2600. Thanks Pinball for sharing this bottle. Pours clear deep golden with no head. loads of apples in the aroma. Some distinct acidic citrussy touch. The flavour has loads of sweet apples, light alcohol, some wood and light vanilla. very powerfull. great stuff.

375 ml bottle shared by shawnm213- thanks again, Shawn!  Pours a pale yellow-gold color with no head to speak of.  Aroma of fresh yellow apples, with some alcohol noticeable.  The flavor follows suit, is really clean and crisp, and feels like an apple wine in the mouth.  Doesnt stand up to the La Face Cachee ice ciders, but still really nice.

Style tasting with Shawn who provided the Éternelle, I brought the rest
1) La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Éternelle 2006
2) La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Ice Cider 2005
3) Domaine Pinnacle Cidre de Glace Ice Cider 2007
4) Etienne Dupont Cidre De Givre Eis Cider 2005 
Pale straw hue with okay oily legs, even some sparkle. The aroma has notes of light crisp young apple with some light phenols, touch of minty vapours. The taste is cleaner and fresher apple juice than the others tasted but it also lacks any depth and because of this I think the alcohol is more apparent. Very smooth mouth feel. While hardly flawed, this is simply outclassed by the others.

Tried  1)la face de la pomme  neige eternelle 2006, 2) la face de la pomme neige 2005, 3) domaine pinnacle ice cider 2007, and 4) cidre de givre 2005 side by side by side....  


1) was received from glouglouburp through trade- thanks dany.  you da man.  2-4 graciously shared by bbb63-  thanks mike!  this was awesome.  


Appearance: 
1-3 are all very clear.   1 and 2 are a clear watery amber with 2 ever so slighly darker than 1.  3 was a clear golden yellow.  no head.  4 poured a hazy murky  pond water orange brown.  
 

more important stuff
1)  similar to 2.  more earthy, less tart.   found myself drinking this one the most.  kept coming back to it.  needed to get seconds of this.  the earthiest of the 4.  score: 4.1
2)  deep sweet apple goodness.  more tart than than 1.  both are solid.  more complex than 1.  The tartness really gives a nice layer to this.  tight.   score: 4.5
3) Most subtle of the 4 and the least sweet.   Think white grapes and white wine apple.  score: 3.7  
4)  sweetest of the 4.  stands out as being a lot different than the other three.  a caramel candied apple sugar sweetness.  nice. caramel, sweet aple crisp. The most different of the 4.  a lot of candy and caramel notes that were more present than the others.  some syrup and honey notes as well.  good stuff.  can see this going well with an apple stroodle (msp) or other apple dessert.  score 4.1

A Mes rate. Bottle at home massive thanks to Ang via Dany GloglouburpIm just a huge fan of ice cider, and this is no exception. Massive alcohol and apple concentrate snout. Equally mental flavour. Thick and epically juicy, complex yet surprisingly unchallenging. Amazing sugary apples. Utterly beautiful on the palate. Incredibly thick actually. Coats the whole mouth and sticks as long as you want to wait without licking. So much sugar it makes your lips sticky. Why oh why oh why is stuff like this only available in Canada? Thanks Ang, thanks Dany.

Bottle. 250 ml. (2005 Vintage). Courtesy of and split with James. Pours clear gold, almost exactly like apple juice. Aroma is distinctly apple, alcohol, and candied sugars. Mouthfeel is slick and juicy. Body is a bit thin, but fitting for the style. Not a huge fan of ciders, but this ice cider was really very good.

ive had a few of these in my time but ill rate the one i had today. 375 ml LCBO purchased bottle. pours still pale gold with lovely legs. aroma of concentrated apple cider. nice sweet apple dessert flavour, minimal spice profile. one of the better iced ciders on the market (from what ive had). makes up for complexity with availibility.

Bottle from the LCBO. Rating taken from notes August/09.
Tarnished gold liuid has a still pour, but leaves thick legs on the swirl. Nose of fresh and intense apple(like apple syrup), spices, vanilla, some wood (oak), perfume. Smells very inviting. The flavour profile is just as intense. Lots of fresh concentrated apple, spices, some toffee, vanilla, a bit oaky towards the finish. Very high concentration towards the end, long intense finish. Medium bodied and delicious.
Clear watery with golden glimts. Sweet aroma with apples, peach and grapes. Flavour had apples, peach, white wine and grapes. Finished dry. Nice.

Tried this beer while on Beer Quest 2010 with the guys. This was beer number 40. Pours like apple juice. Aroma is wine and apple. Delicious in all ways. Flavor is just like juice. Bought a bottle cause i liked it so much.
Clear straw colour.  Aroma is intense apple citrus.  Taste is thin, apple with the astringent aftertaste of alcohol.  Quite nice although not as sweet as I would prefer.

375ml bottle shared courtesy of TomDecapolis. 2006 vintage. Poured a medium golden color with no head. Aromas of, well, apples with some bread. Tastes of the same. Sweet apple start with a green apple tart finish.

Golden color with no head but sticky legs on the glass.  Aroma of granny smith apples, vanilla, wood, and bread.  Taste of citrus, tart green apple, vanilla and alcohol.  The tartness was fantastic on the outside of the tongue. Thanks TomDecapolis!

Pours a translucent golen with no head.  Aroma of apples, apple skins, vanilla, pie crust, short bread cookies.  Flavor of apples, bread, sweet then just total smoothness. So smooth and tasty, sugar cookie goodness.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Bottle at home ... HUGE thanks to Goldorak for this one when he passed through Edinburgh ... crisp light amber ... sweet fruity apple nose  ... sweet apple ... oh so sweet ... but at the same time crisp like biting into a tart apple... fulll boddied ... little syrupy ... definite apple bite in back of throat....  Bottle in Cropredy 2015.. Thanks Fin... Amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet toffee apple fruits nose.. Soft toffee.... Sweet fruits dry toffee apple.. Light spice 3.6

375 mL bottle from Whole Foods Market Glen Allen, VA. Pours a clear pale gold color. Big rich apple aroma. Deep, earthy and sweet with a tart twinge that lends an almost spicy and citrusy note. Taste is tart apples. Very tart but also a sweet note. Thick mouthfeel, full bodied. A nearly portlike character overall. Good cider.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Gold in color with great legs. Aroma is of butter, light band-aid, caramel, butterscotch, and apples. Taste is of apple, caramel, butterscotch and vanilla.

50ml bottle, purchased in 10/05. The cider threw some sediment in that time. Reddish color that was clear before I mixed a bit of the dregs in. The aroma is cinnamon, tart apple and some dark fruits. Oxidation is present, but not in a bad way, though the cider wouldnt seem to be able to age much more, at least not in this size container. Taste is tart apples, wood, dark brown sugar and a prominent dark caramel or toffee flavor. There is enough here to enjoy the small drink that I get, but Ill bet it is much tastier a little more fresh.

Bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  The look is light golden in color nice legs.  The nice smell of applies, fruits, sweetness are there.  Smooth and easy to drink.  Hidden alcohol.  Sweet, fruity, apples.  Nice.

2005 bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  light yellow pour with a few bubbles on top.  nose is vanilla, butter, apples and other good stuff.  great thickness with a smooth apple flavor that blends with the vanilla and butter quite well.

Bottle (375ml), 2006 vintage. Pours a clear, very pale gold with no head. Nice aroma of tart apples, sparkling white wine and some sweet honey. Flavour of tart apples, some wood, alcohol and a bit of sugary sweetness. Medium bodied. Not as syrupy as Id like and a bit boozier then necessary but those are just nit-picks and this is quite good.
Pale yellow body.  Aroma is deep apple, with honey, some wood, flowers and some spices. Flavor is sweet apple, with a bit of sourness, a bit of alcohol, honey and some wood. Very good!

Bottle thanks to Bu11zeye....2005....Pours a bright gold. Aroma of very nice apple, aroma is sweet. Flavor of fresh, sweet apple, nice. Mouthfeel is heavy and smooth.....Overall, very nice cider, some good shit!
(375ml bottle, 2005 vintage)  Pours a yellow body with nice legs.  Aroma of sugary apple.  Flavor of sweet apples and earthiness with a dry wood finish.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, golden color with a few bubbles, strong legs, honey wildflower aroma, sweet, viscous, honey, apple, apple skin, graham cracker flavors, bitter lasting finish

Recolte 2005 bottle thanks to bu11zeye. Pours sickly strong and firm legs produced by the clear golden body. Aroma of moss, cinnamon, alcohol, apple and caramel. Taste is sweet apple, syrup, cinnamon, apple pie and light lemon zest. Syrupy and mouthcoating.
Bottle from Glouglouburp. Huge thanks Dany! Hard to believe this is 12% ABV. Starts sweet apple, vanilla, caramel and honey. Finishes with a bit of tart apple flavor. Excellent!

2005 bottle, aged over 3 years.  Still and clear, the golden hued body sits pure in the glass without carbonation of any sort.  A swirl of the glass reveals runny legging of moderate to high density.  The nose is divine, showing notes of sweet, concentrated apple mash and zesty acidity, with vanilla and hints of wildflower honey.  Theres a very light, earthy mustiness and perhaps even the faintest possible wisp of nuts.  Flavors show more of the same, striking a great balance between sweet and tart apples.  Zesty acidity is cut by the honey component, with vanilla proving itself as a perfect complement.  Showing moderate thickness and viscosity for the iced style, there is a dry tartness that lingers after the finish.  Alcohol is barely detectable despite the 12% ABV.  This one does not quite stack up to some of the elite ice ciders, but it comes in near the top of the second tier examples.

2004 vintage.  Pours a nice syrupy golden yellow with a light copper hue- viscous and thick on the walls of the glass- clear and still.  Aroma is nice sweet fresh pressed thick apples, with a sharp malic acid acidity on the nose- but alcohol is kept to a minimum throughout despite is relatively high abv.  Very thick and syrupy flavor, fresh sweet apples- yet a nice crisp acidity, with some light earth, and honey.  Great light prickly finish with almost no alcohol bite- just very well made and intense.  Great cider.

Clear golden yellow body, still.  Hugely rich and sweet apple nose, very pure, very inviting.  Some spicy floral notes float out of the glass, mostly consumed by the apple character but they do add a unique dimension to this cider.  Semi-sweet flavor, thick, gritty (sugared), overripe red apples all over it, warming, impressive, delicious.  That small note of lavender/spice is pretty nice.

2004 bottle shared by dickinsonbeer at BCTC.  Thanks Paul!  Nose was sweet honey, fresh apples, a bit of alcohol.  Flavor is fresh apples, honey, a bit of tartness. Thick mouthfeel but also very refreshing.  I really love ice ciders and I rarely get to have them so this was a nice treat.

2006.  Bright gold.  Aroma is golden delicious and granny smith apples, with light alcohol and a honey like accent.  Taste is lightly tart with a red apple sweetness balancing the tartness out.  Pretty good stuff.

2006 375ml bottle from HogtownHarry; Nose of what smells to be a combination of apples of variious types, some sweet and some sour; clear gold, no carbination; flavor is swet red apples mixed with a background tartness; finish slightly tart.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2011 The worst part of this cider was that the bottle was 50mL. Great taste and complexity. The aroma is faint, but pleasant. The body is pretty standard. The taste is great though.

Part of trade with beerbuzzmontreal, thanks!  50ml bottle. I was blown away with the level of depth this full bodied cider had.  Having only experienced macro cider (Strongbow, Woodchuck, K) this opened my eyes into the complexity that a cider can have.  I hope to have more of this.

Pours a rather pale yellowish color, and its still.  Smell is a bit faint, and appley, with some hints of spices, like pie.  Its a bit sweeter than Neige, and its a bit tart in the middle and lacks a bit in the finish, it ends a bit quick.  Still very nice.  Mouthfeel is quite viscuous, and syropy, which is really nice.

Much sweeter up front than the various other Quebec ciders (Neige, Neige Eternalle, e.g.) that I tried.  Cloying.  Less fruity as apple, until the late finish when it comes out.  Finishes clean, simply.  Ive enjoyed cider from many places and Im starting to think that I just dont care for the Canadian versions of "cider", in some respects the way I dont care for French ciders...the English are the leaders here. (Montreal Beer Festival, 2008).

Pour at Vices et Versa.  Pours golden and still.  Let me just say that ice cider is amazing...havent found one I dont like.  Aroma is of very sweet apples and skins.  Taste is similar, yet somehow its not cloying despite how amazingly concentrated this apple flavor is.  Mouthfeel is incredibly slick and finishes sweet and slightly tart.

Bottle (375ml - clear, corked).  2006 vintage.  Pours gold, slightly oily looking, no head - nice refraction.  Classic ice cider aroma - tart baked apple and apple skin with light white wine alcohol.  Taste - tart green apple, hint of seed, no oxidation, thick and syrupy, not too cloying, ear-warming alcohol seems just about right.  Perfect mouthfeel - not too thick, acidic and alcoholic in appropriate proportion, nice lip-smacking apple linger.  Yep - another good un

Crystal clear yellow body appears thick without coating the glass.  Sticky sweet apple aroma with a noticeable dry alcohol note in the background.  Sweet tart apple flavor with a cinnamon spice touch.  Sticky sweet coating palate.

Pours gold with long lasting fingers. Mouthfeel is very big and gets to the point of cloying as it warms. Although very sweet this cider is balanced well with a good amount of tart-like sour granny smith apple. Earthy with some skins and a bit of wood. Nose is very perfumey, obvious of apple and some fresh cut flowers. Some tropical fruit floating around in there, pineapple in particular and maybe a bit of passionfruit. Quite nice.
Small pour at Vices et Versa from a bottle. Sweet apple pie, apple brandy aroma, cinnamon, granny smith. Rich, fantastically sweet, icy pear/grapefruit/apple flavor. Huge in body and expression.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 Bottle: Poured a deep golden yellow color cider. Body is really syrupy with some sweet macintosh and some apple pie aspect. Even thought I have to admit that this is well done I found that it is a tad too sweet for my liking.

Re-rate: 2000 vintage drank in 2012. The color of the cider has gone from bright golden to dark copper. The aroma has lost some of the apple pie notes characteristics and now replaced with some tired over ripped apple notes. Definitely pass its peak though interesting experience to taste such an old ice cider.

bottle from robinboyer:  pours an incredible clear golden colour with no head. aroam is outstanding of fresh apples soaking in fresh apple juice, honey blossoms and i think i can smell the cold winter air. the aroma is very clean. flavour is very good fresh apple that is nice and sweet with just enough tart to make it complete. i dont know what else to say about this. it is great to have tried this.

[1057-20080119] 50mL (w/ jerc; Vintage 2003). Sweet earthy wood syrup aroma has a hint of honeyed sherry. Clear, burnt amber body with no head and nice legs. Sweet apple barrel flavour has an evergreen note. Medium body is smooth and finishes boozily. Keeps changing with every waft.

50 ml bottle. Recolte 2003. Dark caramel amber body coats the glass. (3+) Very sweet sugary aroma, concentrated musty apples, light alcohol note grows on some sniff. (7+) Very sweet sugary apples up front with a very tart finish. Hints of burnt caramelized sugars. Bit of a rough grab at the back of the throat. Very light woody notes? Medium palate is smooth but on the lighter side for an ice cider. (3+) Sold but leaves the impression that a fresher sample would retain more fresh fruit character.

50mL sample bottle from Denis (beerbuzzmontreal), thank you.  Clear honey golden with no head--still--with what Id call nice legs.  Aroma of sweet/tart apples and sweet apple juice, light floral (apple blossom?) notes, anda fair amount of alcohol.  Flavor has a nice interplay between the intense sweet and tart qualities, though leans more to the sweet (go figure).  Fair amount of alcohol burn that lets its strength be known.  Full bodied and syrupy.  Very good ice cider, but not the best Ive had.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: huge aroma of apple juice, and honey with an alcohol backdrop. The alcohol coats the glass like a good wine. Flavour is sweet, but enjoyable. Mouthfeel is thick, but not cloying. A nice cider.

Courtesy dsnowden.  Pours a crystal clear bright yellow color, with a syrupy texture.  Big apple juice aroma, picked fresh from the orchard.  Wow, huge tartness hit me very hard at the first sip.  Syrupy mouthfeel, although seemingly medium bodied on the palate.  a little funked out and bitter in the flavor mixed in with the huge apple character.  The taste is very sharp and tart, maybe toned down it might have been a little better.  Still fairly decent cider.

Pours a crystalline and bright yellow.  Fairly benign.  Aroma is a touch muted, but does offer some nice apple and acidic aromas.  The alcohol is more noticeable than in other ice ciders.  Flavor is a bit tame, with a bracing acidity.  very nice.

Date: 02/03/2007
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, Cellar Party

clear pale yellow, small legs, dry apple aroma with a light tartness, big body, rich apple flavor, light tartness, thick and sweet but balanced by the tartness, 

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 8/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.9/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: ***+/4

Clear bottle, 375 ml, 2005; eye: golden with straw reflections, no effervescence, clear; nose: apple concentrate, "freshness"; mouth: sweet, apple concentrate, long finale in concentrated apple, medium body, no carbonation, quite sweet; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille transparente, 375 ml, 2005; oeil : dorée avec des reflets paille, pas deffervescence, claire; nez : concentré de pommes, « frais »; bouche : sucrée, concentré de pommes, longue finale en pomme concentré, corps moyen, pas de carbonatation, assez sucré; en résumé : pas mal bon
Clear golden colour with a very small head. Sweet, vinous aroma with a light alcohol note. Sweet, apple fruity flavor with a light alcohol note in the finish.

Bottle.
Clear golden coloured with a small white head.
Fruity flavour of apples and almonds with notes of wood and alcohol.
Sweet flavour of apples, almonds and wood with notes of alcohol.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2016 2016-06-10, vintage 2012, corked bottle, 8-5-8-4-16=41Nine years later, the perspective is changing. This beautiful bright copper liquid is thick and sweet, it has the flavor of an apple pie, caramel with a pinch of spices, even vinous. Good degree of acidity, and some astringency in the final.Excellent.2007-04-23, 7-3-7-3-13=33Deep blond color, still. Some aroma of apple, but also of plastic. Sweet but not cloying, good body, some concentrated apple sourness; all the elements seem to be there, but I think its nothing special; thou its my first Ice Cider.
Bottle. Aplle juice colour. Sweet apple bit sourish fruity aroma. Flavour of good sweet apples and alcohol, more sweetness, fruity and with more pleasant sweetness.

(Bottle 37,5 cl) Comes as "Pinnacle Ice Apple Wine". Courtesy of Sammy. Clear, warm, amber golden - no head. Intense and very concentrated, strong apple aroma. Extremely full and rich in body with the immensely intense apple accents again. Sweetish - almost like a liqueur. Warming alcohol in the finish. Yummy. 230407

Bottle. This was an amazing experience that reminded me a lot of a good desert wine. No head and of cause no lacing. Clear flat body with a peach like color. Aroma was heavy sweet with notes of pear, apple, acidic, bubblegum. Medium to almost full bodied with a sticky-thick and somewhat alcoholic texture. Flavor was heavy sweet with again a thick sticky sweet finish that lingers for some time. Wow that was really special.
Sample from bottle. Pours golden. Aroma is slight sour but distinct dry apples. Flavour has quick some sweetness followed by a distinct bitterness and sour notes. Finish is dry. Fantastic.
Bottle. Golden colour with no head. Heavy apple, light spicy aroma and taste, very sweet. Medium to full body with a sweet apple finish.

375 ml. bottle of yellow with an ornage amber tinge. Sweet fresh apple aroma. This is a bottle sent and bought in the USA, so labelled as apple wine, no French and no sign of the year. Declicious though on the sweet side, and no harsh cider chacteristics. Richer than other apple fruit wines I remember trying. Great apertif. Very long lasting.

Thanks Taktik_MTL for this suprise gift. Not sure how to rate this since I hardly ever drink ciders. Drank this nice and cold in a snifter while I enjoyed a cigar. The cold apple flavor complimented the cigar nicely. My only problem now is finding more since they dont sell it in NJ yet.

2005 bottle generously shared on 2/3/07 by boboski: Pours a clear bright champagne golden with nice viscous legs.  Fresh, sweet apple aroma has some nice tart fruity notes.  Body starts with a sweet sugary apple flavor nicely balanced with a tart, freshness and a sticky sweet-tart complexity toward a slightly astringent finish.  Otherwise a nice ice cider.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2007 Clear, syrupy yellow pour. Fresh, vibrant aroma of apples, sugar, lighter notes of other commonplace tropical fruits. Flavor is more apples, indistinguishable varieties, closely laced together by an outstanding consistency that is very thick and syrupy but never overwhelming. Palate is very full and feels luxurious. Finishes sweet, never cloying, balance showcased nicely. Alcohol is evident but never prominent. Very nice ice cider, incredibly decadent. The stately presentation is a plus as well.

2005 Bottle:  Poured a clear yellow color with a thick appearance.  The aroma was sweet with tons of crisp apples.  Inlcuded yellow, red and green apples.  Sweet apple flavor.  Light tast of apple cider.  Soooo drinkable and tasty.  Sweet finish with nice warmth.
Bought a bottle at the salon des métiers dart. This product is quality for sure, but I liked the "pétillant" one better. Still, a really goodway to make you happy this holiday season.

2002 Vintage. Thick, syrupy, clear gold. Aroma of apples, pie crust, & cream w/ notes of charred wood. Thick, honeyish feel. Sweet apple sauce flavour w/ dry, peppery alcohol in the finish. Not as complex as the aroma suggests but pleasant nonetheless.
Veyr nice, from the 2004. My first of this type. Sweet but interesting, does nottire.

Verre de dégustation, provenant dune bouteille de 375 ml, dégusté au Festival Bières et Saveurs 2006 (Chambly, QC) lors dune conférence de Stéphane Morin. Arôme: Odeur de pommes cuites et de cassonade. Apparence: La couleur est paille. Saveur: Goût de pommes sucrés avec une pointe de poire. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence de pommes cuites en arrière goût. (Rating #634)

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2010 Golden coloured with a sweet apple aroma. Legs immediately apparent in the glass. Notes of pear. Mouthfeel is slightly more viscous than mead. Definitely apple flavour - like a Riesling ice wine mixed with really quality apple juice. Highly recommended - pick one up in your local SAQ or duty free shop.
Update: A few years on, it seems like either my taste has changed or perhaps it has declined over more recent vintages.
Update 2: Im sure that my tastes are changing; its getting more difficult to drink really syrupy sweet things like this. If thats your bag, though, you cant do too much better than this stuff.

Sampled at Mondial 2006. The appearance is gold. The aroma is muted and tart. There is some sweet apple and flowers. The taste reminded me a little bit of grape juice. The mouthfeel is sticky, but not as much as their other ice cider.
Bouteille de 50ml. Arome de pomme sucré légèrement alcoolisé. Goût très sucré, mais pas fort pour 11%. Très intéressant.

Picked up a 50ml bottle waiting in line to pay for my Hop Head. Came encased in a cardboard tube. Gold liquid with no bubbles. Deep dark apple aroma with a cheese edge.  In an entirely different league than Strongbow et. al. Unfortunately took a sip and half the tiny bottle was gone. Thick apple flavour matching the aroma. I notice the pear notes and the classy texture and flavour. Not sweet or overly syrupy. Light but lasting alcohol and apple finish with a nice sweet edge.  Almost mead-like.

Sampled at Oakes 05 Xmas PartyBourbon, light bronze color, still naturally. Nose of sweet pineapple and apple. The flavor isnt as intense as something like the Frimas but is still a solid Ice cider. Sweet and earthy with complex apple and pear notes.

2002 Bottling  Very clear gold colour, honeyish. Intense sweet apples nose, with a touch of fresh wild dark mushrooms. Very sweet, liqueurish taste, but retronasal typical malonic acid, as green apples. Good, and very balanced IMO, despite the syrupy sweetness. Oily, syrupy MF, light acidic burning touch. Alcohol obvious but not imposing. Very good, IMO, ideal dessert wine. Big thanks to Mike & Bo from me and Lut.

Bottle from 2003.  Clear golden yellow in colour, still with some alcohol lace.  The aroma was of alcohol, apple peels, cinnamon, very sweet.  The flavour was very portish, lots of sugar candy apples, some pastry dough, smooth with some alcohol heat.  Very sweet mouthfeel,  Finishes with a lingering alcoholic apple pie warmth.  This is borderline too sweet.

Full-bodied and frankly sweet, the apple peel tartness and apple pith sweetness seem to balance out pretty well towards the end...The full-on sweetness wins though after a few sips and takes over every corner of your mouth lusciously...An ice cider for the sweet tooth, but I am one, so no problem here...

Extremely sweet nose, clear dark golden, slightly oily looking. Juicy apple flesh that coats the mouth. Honest tartness backup of course doesnt manage to cut the sweetness, but allows you to be able to take a new sip. Port-like woody tannins. Pretty accessible for an ice cider, but no stand-out and certainly one of the sweetest and less successful at containing its alcohol.

Vintage 2002. 27,5 cl corked bottle. Served in plastic cup. Apple gold. No head. Fruity, slightly sharp, acidic apple juice aroma w/ slight alcohol presence. The flavor is heavily dominated by apples w/ some alcohol presence and slight sharpness. Slick, round mouthfeel. Good drinkability for the strength. Thanks for sharing, Jacob!

Vintage 2001
Aroma:apple juice....
Appearance:yellow,amber
Flavor:Apple juice,syrupy texture....
Pours a dark gold color. Aroma of baked apples with alcohol. Flavor of apples with alcohol and a sweet finish. Syrupy texture.

Vintage 2002. Aroma is sweet apples, with just a hint of earth. Pours  light golden Taste is rather on the sweet side, but still nice and fruity. Palate is wonderful creamy, soft, and lasting. A great cider. Thanks Jakob for sharing

[vintage 2002] The aroma is of apples, gorgonzola cheese, and wood. The color is orange with no head. The flavor is very sweet with notes of apples and wood. The mouthfeel is like sirup and the alcohol burns the throat. A fantastic cider. Thanks Jacob, for sharing.

2002 vintage. Deep golden coloured, leaving nice legs on the glass. Apple aroma with notes of Danish champagne brus ice cream. Very thick and soft mouthfeel. Sweet and concentrated flavour of apples and grapes. Very tasty, but expensive.
Apple aroma. Strong riesling like flavour. Pretty warming and enjoyable. Great dessert cider. Thanks Jacob

Vintage 2002.Apple juice appearance, clear golden with no head. Nice and fresh in the aroma, sweet apple with a tone of alcohol. Flavor is extremely heavy for a cider with lots and lots of sweetnsour apples. Thick, soft and warming. A very extreme and tasty cider and not like anything I have tasted before. Thanks a lot Jacob Lövenlund for opening this highly expensive bottle!

The nose is dominated by sweet and fresh green apples, a bit dry. Appearance just like apple juice, no carbonation at all. Lovely sweet flavor, sweet apples with just a touch of acidity, warms nice, ends a bit dry.
This is a wonderful cider, thanks a bunch to Jacob for sharing this expensive gem.

50 ml sampler bottle.  Oily light gold thickly coats the glass, no carbonation appears...warm apples and honey, hints of alcohol in the sweet nostrils...very sweet and thick on the tongue, hinting of pine and vanilla under the heavy honeyd apples, strong alcohol makes itself known late...fairly syrupy and thick, and a touch of iron...the alcohol burn goes on forever.  A bit sharp for everyday drinking, but memorable.
Strong cider of very high quality Rich, juicy sweet true apple sugars. Big cider, high alcohol content made it warm and pleasant. Best Cider I had so far.
Bewitching perfume-like apple aroma. Clear yellow apple juice appearance. Thick apple sauce. Chewy, sweet apple flan. Definite alcohol warming. Bottle (sampled at Mondial 2004).

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2004 (375ml bottle) Pours an apple juice colour. Nose is more sweet than the Glace de Pomme ice cider. Definitely sweeter in flavour but with a tartness always on the tip of your tongue. Syrupy in texture. Far more alcohol is detected then the Clos Saint-Denis. Very good.
